titleStmt.title: By the Queene. The Queenes most excellent Maiestie consyderyng that the great [and] horrible conspiracies, treasons, and rebellions lately practised, attempted, and with open action prosecuted in the north partes of her hyghnesses realme by the earles of Northumberlande and westmerlande ...
Proclamations. 1569-02-18
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

publicationStmt.publisher: In Powles Churchyarde by Richarde Iugge and Iohn Cawood, Printers to the Queenes Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: A proclamation pardoning certain rebels in the North.
Last complete line of text ends: "inheritaunce".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
